intro: Euphrasia crispata, commonly known as the curled toothwort, is a delicate herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers typically bloom from May to July, and it is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Euphrasia crispata is also noted for its medicinal properties, having been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
